seg.seg: Doubt had risen [in] him concerning that. The Buddha, the master, [is] alive briefly ...
Or cannot the master fulfill the service of Buddha? The doubt concerning this totally ... (like) in the Kṛtayuga-time the beings ...
just so through the marvel of sunrise all beings had grown gentle and glad then. Therefore the Buddha, the master, the wonder (?) ...

Accordingly, (the rays) [furnished] with [a] mind as it were, turned [and] once again took up their position in the body of the Buddha, god of gods. Rising from [his] meditation, (then out of) pity (the Buddha, the master),
Unmittelbar darauf kehrten (die Strahlen), gleichsam mit Geist [versehen], um [und] nahmen wieder in dem Körper des Göttergottes Buddha Platz.
Immediately afterwards (the rays), [provided] with a mind, as it were, turned around [and] took their place again in the body of the god of gods, the Buddha.
Aus der Kontemplation sich erhebend, rief (alsdann aus) Mitleid (der Buddha, der Meister), mit schallender, tönender, lieblicher Brahmasvara-Stimme den Ānanda [und] sprach zu ihm:
Rising from contemplation, then, (the Buddha, the Master), (out of) pity, called Ānanda with [his] resounding, sonorous, lovely Brahmasvara voice [and] spoke to him:
with a sounding, ringing, lovely Brahmasvara-voice he called upon Ānanda and said to him: Am I able, oh Ānanda, in 45 years’ time, to fulfill the entire service
of a Buddha? Thereupon Ānanda, imbued, as it were, with joy [and] longing, looking with [his] (lotus)coloured, gentle eyes, smiling,

at the face of the god of gods, the Buddha, says: || In the C.-tune: || Very long [are] 45 years (oh lord, very) long [are] 45 years, [my] father. If (all) the beings that [are] trapped in the four continents
were [to be redeemed], they [would] all be to be redeemed by you in one [single] moment. 1. ... could you redeem [them] in one [single] moment. You will not fail (to redeem) them, either.
Oh for the great ability of the Buddha rank. 2. What sort of an excited (evil being) it would have to be, which does not at all times have the wish for the Buddha rank.
Was muss das für ein gedanken(loses, böses) Wesen sein, das nicht ständig den Wunsch nach der Buddhaschaft hegte!
What a thought(less, evil) being this must be, who does not cherish the wish for Buddhaship at all times!

For asaṃkhyeyas [of years] for sure it would have to burn in hells. Never, either, should a being turn away from the Buddha rank. (3. Thereupon) the worthy Ānanda, remembering his own turn(ing) away from the Buddha rank,
virtually feeling embarrassed in front of the beings of the 5 births, [his] heart compressing, as it were, pained by great remorse, with tears in his eyes
... sich gleichsam schämend vor den Wesen der fünf Geburtsklassen ...
... being ashamed, as it were, before the beings of the five incarnations ...

looking at (the Buddha), speaks: || In the Ā.-tune: || If I had known before, brother, that the Buddha rank is so excellent, and that for each moment, for as many moments as there are in three asaṃkhyeyas,

If I had known before, brother, that the Buddha rank is so excellent, and that for each moment, for as many moments as there are in three asaṃkhyeyas, I would have had to work three asaṃkhyeyas and one hundred kalpas in the Avīci [hell] with glowing body, then I would never have returned from my wish for the Buddha rank. (cf 33)
I would have had to work three asaṃkhyeyas and one hundred kalpas in the Avīci [hell] with glowing body, then I would never have turned from my wish for the Buddha rank.
1. (If I), for the sake of all beings of the Saṃsāra, as a share for each one of them (had known) suffering for 10 million of asaṃkhyeyas only with [my] Avīci-body,
I would (not) have turned from my wish. For very good, very great [is] the Buddha rank. Oh [ye] good (beings), do not turn [away] from the Buddha rank! 2. Thereupon ...
the beings, belonging to boroughs, [having seen] this wonderful and amazing (event) of the Buddha Lord of Lords ...

śonäṃtwaṃ from *śoṃ 'continent, cf. TB Pl. Nom. Obl. śconaṃ 'id.' (260).
260 suggests to link ṣom k[ṣ]aṃ to the following mā nu cesmi tärkā(l tsälpālune) naṣt and to translate “you, also, will not fail for one moment to redeem them”.
260 supplements the first word of b8 as (āpṣā)trikāñ, suggesting to translate as 'ājīvika' or 'craftsman'.

a7: The restoration in [[Sieg, Übers. II]]: 33.n5 (nātäk : ṣokyo) would require 6 akṣaras (including the punctuation mark) but [[TochSprR(A)]]: 170 only posit 5 positions. (BK)

b5-b6: [[Sieg, Übers. II]]: 33.n17 restore o(ntaṃ lotka)l, which leaves the pada one syllable short. This restoration further only requires 3 akṣaras, while [[TochSprR(A)]]: 170 leave room for 4, so one could restore o(ntaṃ nu lotka)l or o(ntaṃ näṣ lota)l instead, both of which would scan. (BK)

b6: [[Sieg, Übers. II]]: 33.n18 restore ko(r a)saṃkhesyo, while [[Carling, DThTA]]: 165.kor restore ko(ris a)saṃkhesyo. The latter seems to fit neither the lacuna nor the meter. (BK)
